title: Celtics bench shines in bounce-back win over Magic: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Boston Celtics defeated Orlando Magic 111-107 in Orlando, splitting their two-game series.
Luka Garza scored 16 points with 8 rebounds, impacting Celtics' victory despite Neemias Queta's foul issues.
Jordan Walsh contributed defensively and hit a crucial three-pointer, enhancing his case for rotation minutes.

title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jason Varitek signs a new contract to remain with the Boston Red Sox for the 2026 season.
Varitek has served in various roles with the Red Sox since 2012, currently focusing on game-planning and run prevention.
Carlos Narvaez, a pivotal rookie catcher, impressed in 2025 with a .241 average, 15 home runs, and Gold Glove finalist honors.

title: Patriots’ explosive rookie class breaks through at perfect time in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookies Kyle Williams and TreVeyon Henderson scored three touchdowns in a 28-23 victory over the Buccaneers.
Williams and Henderson combined for 222 of the Patriots' 435 total net offensive yards during Sunday's game.
Rookie defensive contributions included Craig Woodson's eight tackles and Elijah Ponder's first career sack against Tampa's Mayfield.

title: Oddsmakers have Drake Maye as NFL MVP favorite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye leads the NFL MVP race according to oddsmakers like FanDuel and DraftKings.
Maye threw for 270 yards and two touchdowns in the Patriots' 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
This season, Maye has completed 71.7% of passes for 2,555 yards, 19 touchdowns, and five interceptions.

title: Rob Gronkowski announces that he will ‘retire as a Patriot’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rob Gronkowski announced he will sign a one-day contract with the Patriots, officially retiring as a member of the team.
Gronkowski spent nine seasons with New England, winning three Super Bowls, and set franchise records for receiving touchdowns.
Gronkowski co-hosts a podcast with Julian Edelman and works for Fox Sports after his NFL career concluded in 2022.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Buccaneers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams scored key touchdowns, leading the Patriots to a 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
The Patriots' offensive line improved, allowing only one sack and creating running lanes for a successful ground game.
Drake Maye's completion rate dropped to 51%, yet he connected on crucial deep plays to maintain the Patriots' win streak.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ impressive road win over Buccaneers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots extend win streak to seven games with a 28-23 victory over Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams led Patriots' offense with three combined touchdowns, totaling 222 yards.
Quarterback Drake Maye completed 16-of-31 passes for 270 yards, two touchdowns, and one interception against the Buccaneers.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Transit Police officer Jonathan Daveiga, 27, charged with DUI after crashing into a pole at Leverett Circle.
Daveiga pleaded not guilty and was released on personal recognizance; next court appearance set for Dec. 19.
Officer placed on modified duty; State Police noted signs of intoxication and automatic license suspension invoked.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine Allston Car Wash employees with work permits were detained by ICE on November 4 during a federal raid.
Attorney Todd Pomerleau reports detainees faced mistreatment and difficulty accessing legal aid; one was allegedly moved to Texas.
ICE claims the workers entered the U.S. illegally, while local politicians and advocacy groups criticize the operation.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nikki Glaser hosted 'Saturday Night Live' on November 8, 2025, with Sombr as the musical guest.
Glaser's popularity surged after the Tom Brady roast in 2024, leading to high-profile hosting roles.
Pete Davidson returned to the 'Weekend Update' desk during Glaser's 'SNL' episode.
